channel.title: Message to all in [delta] help please!
channel.description:
Hello,
Ive posted this quite a few times in the past and nobody has responded so i went away and tried to do again but no success. I just wondered if somebody could advise me in how to make it so every 5 or 6 minutes the server will yell "vote for this server" then after that in 5 mins it will yell the same thing and so on.
Help would be very much apreciated.
Thank you

item.title: Message to all in [delta] help please!
item.dc:creator: @pk_george1 pk george1
item.description:
@pk_george1 wrote:

Thank you very much i see the way i was doing it was completely wrong.

Thank your very much for posting

Apreciated

Btw wouldnt it be “yell” then the message instead of “sM”

Read full topic
item.source: Message to all in [delta] help please!

item.title: Message to all in [delta] help please!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

public int messageTimer;

In the process method:

if (messageTimer > 0) { messageTimer -= 1; }

if(messageTimer == 0) { sM("Vote for my server, you bitch."); messageTimer = 600; }

That’s for every 5 minutes, I think. It’s an inefficient way, but it gets the job done.

Read full topic
item.source: Message to all in [delta] help please!

item.title: Message to all in [delta] help please!

item.description:
@pk_george1 wrote:

Ive worked a long time with delta and done lots of different stuff of my own. By ive used timers and when the timer equals to the time it yells and then after the time of yelling it resets and starts over again. But doesnt seem to yell

Read full topic
